Hi

is there any way to reference an object (contact / company) via an hashed ID like uuid/guid?
Background: I need to pass the ID through a link and therefore it should not be guessable / countable.
Is he/she a super admin?  I believe only super admins can install apps.
Hello guys! Is there any public API I can use to interact with HubSpot Service Hub? I would like to have a possibility to manage knowledge articles

Hi,
How can I fetch all the properties of objects having HubSpot names and internal names, since HubSpot names are different than the ones I am getting through an API.\
Also, there are certain enumeration fields which have different values, there names are also different than the ones in HubSpot when I am fetching those values.
I need to create a mapping therefore need to export all the properties

Hi!

We’re facing issue with search endpoint limitation in 10 000 rows. Is there any way to temporary increase it till 50 000?

Found what was happening, my endpoint got changed from v3 to v1.

For reference for anyone else,  you can use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners> go to endpoints and use the GET one.

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1706107824267659?thread_ts=1706023624.015419&cid=C2YHAHB6K|Reference> for you if you are trying to get owner names and IDs. I was trying to get all owners/users out of HubSpot with their Internal Values (can't export Users because it's not internal values for APIs).

I'm creating line items over API to a deal, but the deal amount is not updating. If I go into the line items menu and hit save after, the deal amount updates. Is there some kind of trigger I need to send to the deal to recalculate?

Hi Thomas, missed this so sorry for slow response. I don't believe extraData shows up as a token, it needs to be added explicitly in the details template like this (from <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline>)
Hello - is there a way to connect HubSpot with Google Cloud Platform through a workflow API/webhook? - Does this require using the custom code workflow option?
Hey <@U06EULVD42K>, spamming is not permitted in this community. I'm deleting this post, and if we hear of any more violations, we may need to remove you from the community.
Thank You. I solved it with Markup and that works also pretty well.
I don’t think so, not currently.

Properties per object can be pulled using the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|Properties API> - specifically, the endpoint: GET*`/crm/v3/properties/{objectType}`*

And to Clayton’s point above, there are a few properties that have a bit more complexity to them, and will require a few extra steps to retrieve, such as “owner” based properties.

Hey all, I'm trying to search for all Companies associated to a specific domain (domain and hs_additional_domains) but I'm running into some strange behavior.
It appears that whenever I filter against the hs_additional_domains, I can't use wild-cards (when using CONTAINS_TOKEN) and the search value is case sensitive.
I've tried the Equals (EQ) and Contains Token (CONTAINS_TOKEN) operators but each time, it only finds the companies if the search value operating against the hs_addtional_domains has an exact case sensitive match.
How do I effectively search against the hs_additional_domains property when I can't know the exact casing of the characters?

Hey all. I don't know if this is the right place to put this, but I am trying to install the HubSpot plugin on our Wordpress site. It installs and activates fine, but when I click the "Connect website" button I get the following error:

lang=en-US
The state parameter is empty

...which is a Wordpress error. I talked to HubSpot support and was told...

_it appears, this needs to be added from the platform's end, as our installation process will start with the oAuth request, and then the platform should add the parameter and allow the user to continue with the process, it appears Wordpress is not adding the parameter and thus does not validate the app._

Has anyone come across this error before, and if so, any guidance on how to resolve it? It seems to be an oAuth error, but I don't know why my site wouldn't be doing what it's supposed to in that regard.

Thanks in advance. Hope everyone is off to a great new year!

Looking to add a form in a custom app for ticket creation in HubSpot. Has anyone set up a way to auto-populate form fields based on known data in the app (e.g. email, first name, last name)?
Or is it better to just build a form in the app and then send it over through the forms API?
Thnak you so much! its working now :slightly_smiling_face:

anytime

asking this because I heard only enterprise subscription plan gives access to custom objects
